conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: walls have clear height/thickness, multiple faces are visible per wall, interior volumes read as spaces, and the view is angled/isometric with the ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with readable wall thickness and corners; cutaway is clean and interior is visible. Minor perspective/scale cues are slightly inconsistent across spaces but overall solid.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacency largely match (3 bedrooms, central living/dining, kitchen/utility zone, multiple toilets, office/maid room). However, balcony/deck treatment and some bathroom/partition placements appear simplified or not fully faithful to the 2D plan, and several openings (doors/windows) do not clearly align one-to-one.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture is present (beds, sofa seating, dining table), kitchen is modeled, and bathroom fixtures appear in at least some toilets. Some rooms (especially toilets/utility) look simplified with less fixture/detail parity versus the plan.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is generally readable with consistent materials and a clean background. Interior visibility is good, though some walls/openings are visually ambiguous due to similar tones and glazing, reducing plan-to-render traceability.

detected_errors.description: Balcony/deck areas from the 2D plan are not clearly or fully represented with matching extents/locations in the 3D model (appears simplified/partially omitted).
Several door/window placements and opening sizes are not clearly consistent with the 2D plan (alignment and proportions appear generalized).

Bathroom/toilet count and/or internal partition geometry appears partially consolidated or repositioned relative to the 2D plan (plan shows more distinct toilet rooms than are clearly resolved in 3D).

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with strong volumetric modeling, but with noticeable fidelity gaps in balcony/deck and some toilet/partition/opening alignment versus the 2D plan.
